otGyGCBigpkMxdrupsJ7gQ.text: This is the second time I've visited when they were out of the wine I requested. Both times I was offered the more expensive label of the same grape as an alternative. A kind gesture one might say!  Until you see that they charged the higher amount on your bill. If it were my restaurant, I would only charge for the less expensive wine as a way to say "I'm sorry we were out of your wine."  Also, the minestrone soup cup is tiny.  Please offer a bowl.

eJIRiw1hemSWiI0HCGqfpg.text: If you enjoy bad manhattans, fruit flies, and cold, indifferent service, you will love this place.

1OoU0J_jDNaL6xjnpT8Peg.text: I uploaded a photo of my burned pizza. I don't usually complain but since I fly all the time and only had a few minutes for food I was completely disappointed! They could do way better for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really you only have a few minutes to spare and they burn the pizza? I am disappointed! Waste of money

fSvSztPKlrvhfkTnjTx6Ow.text: Ate here passing thru from LA to Chicago. This was the second time I've eaten their pizza. I order "cheese and sausage"... although it's not on the menu, per se, they happily make it. Personal pizza and a soda was around $16. Not bad considering you're in an airport where prices are always high. The pizza came out in about 8 minutes. Crispy and hot! Very tasty too.  Everyone's entitled to their opinions and I'm not here to refute my fellow Yelpers but my 2 visits were great! It's a very welcome change from fast food burgers. Suggest you try their pizza if you're in the Phoenix airport!

b3vhWF3c1jKfsAsO8gQCJA.text: I really enjoyed the pepperoni pizza here, and it is surprisingly good for airport food. The one thing about this place that was not good was the tapwater. It tasted like it came from the ocean, as it had a very salty taste which I found undrinkable. Upon research this flavor of the water seems normal for the area, so the restaurant should not be marked down for that.

Ua3LbOxtwKKOM3HF2ktknw.text: Okay, so I wasn't sure how long it would be to get a table or what the quality of the food was going to be like (face it: airport food usually is sub par at best). I got a table (it was pretty slammed) for one in less than 5 minutes. The pizza is SO GOOD (and pizza is #1 on my "favorite foods list" and my waiter, Eric, was super attentive and fantastic. I highly recommend this over any airport restaurant I've ever been to. Kudos to y'all, Humble Pie!

rBoUtSQET34awUtw3lrU5A.text: The worst pizza I've ever had. Reading the menu one would think it's pretty tasty--- NOT! I got a burnt pizza with no flavor mozzarella. The basil was burnt as well. The sauce was dumped in the pizza so it was soggy on top with burnt crust. Blehkkkk!!! If I have time to return it I would but I was boarding as soon as I got my pizza so that was a waste of $12.00. Save yourself the $12 and buy something else.

EuK025XjS5IHmdgv8bugNg.text: Solid airport food. Ordered two pizzas and they came out fast (ie didn't have to worry about missing boarding). We got the sausage and the roast mushroom. Both were tasty with fresh toppings and a nice chewy crust.  Food was good, the beer was cold, and the service was fast. What more do you want from an airport restaurant?

OI5RGwlUtfcnpGYjD8nOOQ.text: I thought the pizza was awesome.  I got the margarita and it had very fresh toppings.  The dough was thin and a little thicker on the ends.  The sauce tasted fresh.  The staff was friendly and quick.  We are here twice on the way to and from San Diego. Both times were just as great.

KmSbkrsjAtQghoOz5DQAJg.text: Only tried the bar before boarding a plane but the staff were quick & helpful which is more than I can say for their neighbors. I've tried the pizza at the downtown location & the pizzas coming out looked good too.

LX98-dnE0MSUuYerhvmJpw.text: Early morning flight, not much open. Ordered an egg, bacon and cheese wrap with fruit for $10.99. They put 2 partial slices of bacon and a couple bits of egg in the tortilla and 5 small pieces of fruit. Went and complained and they "fixed" it. Put a maybe 1 full it the same tortilla.   Sorry I bothered.... Horrible. Maybe pizza is better....

7c8E-hxnI1WZmv0Ju4EwdA.text: Warm beers, dirty bar, burnt pizza and no customer service. We are stuck in the airport terminal or else we would have left and found a better spot.

UFqLBdnnbnCiHZITZX874Q.text: Pretty good for airport food. Pizza was mostly bread (good bread but still).  Little on the pricey side but again, what do you expect in the airport. Would have gone for more sauce, chicken and cheese for price.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pesto pizza
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VaBch_280A1B_TW_fXQXNA.text: The Fig Pizza is disgusting!  Besides taking 20 minutes and being horribly undercooked, it had this white rubber all over the top of it.  They didn't even bother to add synthetic goat cheese flavor to the rubber.  The "pancetta" was artificial thin sliced ham pieces soaked in that saline preservative all day.  Really yucky stuff!!!

IIUsyddeLNAmv_ua1jnYLQ.text: Great service and great food! This place definitely makes a long flight delay more bearable. We love the pizza and the meatball appetizer. Sit at the full service bar and let Floyd take care of you. He's attentive and professional!

9qLN6DfkP6BU3Qnl7pb5LQ.text: Even for airport food this is pretty low quality. Step up your game if you expect to stay in terminal 4!  Ordered a margherita pizza...very plain, flimsy crust, underwhelming.

OmB6GWaYRHXckh9SC718sQ.text: Love Humble Pie at their other locations, this location is very disappointing. Have visited several times and not been very happy, but today was particularly bad. Ordered meatballs, they came out cold, not warm but cold. Maybe room temp if lucky. Also ordered a pretzel. It had the most terrible taste, I can best describe it as melted plastic. I will never visit this airport location again.

2PmkQwHKnneZMPCem2AzOg.text: Horrible horrible horrible horrible service!  Who know's how good the food is.  I never got to try it.  After being seated and waiting for over a half hour, I had a server run by telling me she'd be right back........I never saw her again.  I finally gave up.  I certainly would never try this place again.  Good luck to those who do.

Tl_J8gbWlJnlPvTjaQ0LBg.text: People were nice, but easily the worst pizza I've had. I only finished it because I spent $12 on a margherita pizza and I was starving. It's difficult to destroy a pizza, and they did it. Absolutely gross tasting.

C9NtgprKTGTpYSA6OflFmg.text: For airport food this place deserves 4 stars in my opinion: very clean and organized and the guy in the counter super friendly, fast yet very attentive. I picked up a salad before my flight and all the ingredients were very fresh, plus the vinaigrette dressing was the perfect blend. The strawberries in the salad were like just picked up from the field, red and plumply and the whole package was abundantly filled with various ingredients, like the pecans. I was very satisfied also with the raspberry drink, very thick, good blend and delicious. The layout of this restaurant is a little bit on the narrow side but everything else looks good.

wfb9kTUT7P3P9W_G6TN5FA.text: Bruce is a great Maitre d' very friendly service was quick and efficient'. It was very crowded but he was able to get us in quickly hassle free.   Staff handles a lot of people in a short period of time it's not an easy job!

-1XiQczI2-KaZImTZSACSA.text: Spend your money next store at the Mexican spot. I had the FIG & PROSCIUTTO pizza... ummm I've never had prosciutto like that, I'd call it bacon. The onions were not caramelized they were cooked and tasteless. The fig jam was low quality. I had to add so much salt to the pizza to give it any flavor. To top it off it is small. It is no larger than a standard plate with about a inch or so of crust.  $18 for this pizza. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is my waitress (Rebecca per the receipt) kept my Pepsi filled and was super pleasant!

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prosciutto and fig, flavorless waste of money

VCbawbVNpUuV5fuH9Zi6pQ.text: Where do I start? Waited over 30 mins for wings. MGR refused to apologize. The waitress was super rude as I sat down. It took them 20 mins to take off wings off my order after I said I was tired of waiting & didn't want them. The waitress promised that the MGR was coming to apologize and never did. 1. Communicate with the customer. 2. If you don't like people or refuse to have some level of customer service ... maybe bartending or managing a restaurant isn't the right job for you! Beware of this place! Smh! The customers are the ones paying your wages. As I was leaving I was told that I was hostile & raising my voice however at no time did I raise my voice. Very poorly managed & staffed restaurant.

qZXm2G0ooV_NojkM4oVu2g.text: Slow and rude service at the to-go counter, and over-priced. Don't order here if you have limited time before your flight

bA1YcZ3egRznmE4qs-11JQ.text: Would not recommend this place. Waste of money. So expensive! There was hardly any taste to my pesto chicken pizza & hardly any cheese either. Keep walking!

LXMgecJLHuc2I5i0WaXHHA.text: Ordered pizza to go and once I got on my plane I noticed it was extremely burnt. Was unable to return it since I had to board my flight as soon as I received it.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3cQuGBMPgY-32XNHdh88OQ.text: Both of our breakfasts came with funky fruit. My guess is that it was in too cold of fridge so it came out mushy and with that slightly transparent look that happens to melon when kept too cold. The server brought us replacements that were just as bad. Why bring back fruit that looked like the last one? Got a soft sorry but no attempt to offer something else (maybe they didn't have any alternatives?)  and nothing done with the bill.   The bloody's were $15 a piece (high even by airport standards?) and were nothing special and - actually - were rather small... Served in a glass that looked like a pint but was definitely smaller.   Lastly, the service was a bit slow as well.  I will say my omelette was solid.

H_QFm4gnjjc3DIw2CRYGBQ.text: If there was a zero star I would use it. Saturday morning we had plenty of time before the plane boarded. We ordered breakfast and 35 minutes later and no food , the waitress Ginger came over  and said " I forgot to put your order in." By this time we were out of time, starving and had to get to the gate. We left and will never be back. Had to sit on a plane for 3 hours with a bag of pretzels.  No excuse. Never had this happen.

MYJX5IUl7b9NpiGvYAUtRw.text: Bar and counter seats are first come first serve, and yes you can order food.   With that out of the way, this is a very busy spot especially when you've been delayed on the lower C gates (it's located between the higher C gates and the D) I was able to find a spot right away, didn't have much time, was only delayed an hour.   Thy had a pretty good beer selection, will serve it to you in a glass if you want. The server was friendly and talkative as he poured me my pale ale, it really took the edge off, and he was right back to see if I needed my bill, was able to get one more brew down and paid for before my B1-30 boarding group was called.   Want to come back for the pie.

Ui9GX1eX8EwoiAJ5uCRNJQ.text: Early Flight. I googled restaurants open in the airport at 0515 am. Humble Pie said to open at 0530 am. Walked across airport to eat here instead of a walk up since I'm in a wheelchair and those spaces are hard to manuever and manage your food.  0530 comes and goes. Around 0540 ask when they open and guy mumbles something about not serving alcohol until 0600 am. I don't want alcohol, I need food. People milling around, then some group meeting, more milling around, no sense of urgency. More people coming up asking if open. Meanwhile, other 2 walk ups are open next door. We didn't eat here. Ridiculous

AwbPuW-E_dZHzBGoxta9Gg.text: Awful service. I have a 2 hour layover and this is the only place that services alcohol in the terminal.  The bartender was awful attitude.  She said that they don't have house wine.  I said just pick one she just handed the menu back.  It has been over a decade since I left $0 tip she deserved every penny.  I actually read the reviews and wow I am not the only one.

fAp0oa4tM6eJ9QugB3kGRQ.text: Located in front of gate C4, it is a great option for a quick hot breakfast. 10 minute guaranteed. The Meat Lovers omelet is definitely a good choice. Served with fresh fruit, toasts and sliced tomatoes was definitely a good way to jump start my morning. The coffee was also ready good, not too dark and served just at the right temperature.   Rebecca the waitress was very friendly and very diligent, however the hostess had a little bit of an attitude, I normally don't like to write this type of comment on my reviews, but the hostess of a restaurant that it is located inside an airport has to be friendlier and has to provide the potential clients with the information in regards estimated wait time.  Overall I am very pleased with my selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat lovers omelette

4OVk7t45RyHT1skAaMby3g.text: This is the not place to go if you have just 2 1/2 hours before your flight (well, in my experience).  I ordered the strawberry gorgonzola with chicken salad and my co-worker got the patty melt with a side salad.  It took approximately 40 minutes to get our food.  There was a table next to us where they asked for to go boxes even before their food came and they were seated before us!    Finally when our food came, we swallowed everything.  I remember it was good but not good when you're eating in a rush.    I will probably go there again only if I have 4 hours before my flight.  In translation, NEVER.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry gorgonzola salad with chicken
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patty melt with side salad

SeRE-Q4PVkDIDqttiCG7Tw.text: Food is so good! Drinks are okay but don't hold up for the pricing. If you like a good burger come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Disappointing Michelada
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hUizIu_sk0a25GpdxTU4kQ.text: Cold coffee, asked 3 times for new cup... still luke warm. Piss poor service and the bartending is horrific. I understand the airport is.... well, the airport, but there is a point where $15 a drink should garner some sort of quality. I'd advise you to bring your own food and at this point... drinks.

3t0Bg8KTveVMPSastIi91w.text: Rude severs, confusing layout, slow service. The server told me I couldn't have a seat at a table because I ordered from their cash register and not from a menu while seated. I took a table anyway but when I tried to add a 3rd chair to the two chairs around the table I was told that wasn't allowed so I had to stand while my children sat in the two chairs to eat. I was on the verge of tears.

8UiDxNfKXjcY7x-M5Otd_Q.text: I ate the egg pizza. The crust and toppings were good. It wasn't the best pizza I have ever had. The waitress asked if we wanted avocado and never mentioned there was an up charge which was annoying. Overall, I would only go back if I had to. Not to choice for pizza.

M3Q9EFM6fG366O8Tyq1Rgw.text: Way over priced and the menu is a joke. Might as well hand over your wallet when you sit down. A cheese pizza is $11.99 but a pepperoni is $16.49? Keep in mind it's only a 10 inch pizza. I get we are at the airport but this should be illegal.

oFo6qWEJf9lqRqFQOHfjGg.text: We should have read the reviews before we wasted our time and money here.  The kitchen is very disorganized and our servers was RUDE.  After waiting at least 30mins for 2 cold pizzas our server argued with us and said they were hot.  They were stone cold.  They begrudgingly remade our pizzas in 12 mins but we had to ask for them to go because we had been there so long.  Bad attitude and 3 times the price of their restaurant in Scottsdale.  Granted they are at the airport but at least they can have their act together.  I think it's time for a different restaurant in that space!!

7_oBDBeHCm6NoFtJcJZD8A.text: Another lovely  example of sub par customer service at airports. Walked in and sat around for 5 minutes in a near empty place. No server. Bar guy looked at me a couple of times. Left. Wonder if the food is good?

_WbUHvpOkl2qnSA-w66-uA.text: The waitstaff is so friendly, nice seating and atmosphere but those are about the only positive things at this Humble Pie's cooking staff is terrible. They do not keep tickets in order, stop for social chats and giggles despite a back up of tickets, and then finally serve over or undercooked food. I get it's an airport location but have some standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eOxYageboNz9yRXrhFbvfw.text: Don't bother going here even if the to-go line is shorter than the other food places. I would have gotten my food faster if I had gone in the longer lines at one of the other food places. I had a lot of time until my flight but these guys pushed that to the limit. I thought I'd go healthier with a grilled chicken sandwich and it was terrible. It was a bit overcooked on the outside and difficult to bite. But what was worse was that I asked for fries and got chips. The person who took my order said it would come with lettuce and tomato and there was none. It was just grilled chicken, slice of cheese and bun. Pretty terrible experience. But I will say the wings I saw someone eating looked pretty incredible. So maybe stick with unhealthy options and you'll be alright.

9FQv0bjP6oM4fgn8wX5XTQ.text: I liked the toasted ravioli.  Our waiter was nice and fast.  I wish I didn't eat out of MSY before my layover in PHX.  I was very lucky to have been seated near an outlet to charge my phone.

Z6IO5Uot35S-vqV2-o-l9Q.text: The pizza is garbage. No, really, it's for for the garbage.  Got the Buffalo chicken, and there was like 4 pieces of overcooked chicken bits.  The rest was just f'n overpriced garbage.

XXAXiUncSqo-X0lOL46_eA.text: So slow if you have flight within the next hour and a half don't eat here. The pretzel appetizer is literally a frozen pretzel from the grocery store warmed up and served with Dijon mustard. No service at all and ridiculously slow.

-6AqUhuX6lpwYmICDjCPcA.text: Probably the poorest excuse for a restaurant. I ordered a breakfast wrap for $10 and it was about the size of a tennis ball with maybe 1 full piece of bacon inside if I'm being generous. I got a bottle of water as well... $6.50 for that. If this place wasn't inside the airport, it'd be closed in about a week. I can get an equivalent or better breakfast from Circle K for about $3.

vgaDrULTVVyed12k6vY0UQ.text: Not even sure the purpose of this place being open early in the morning for breakfast.  I guess this is a bit of a live review because I just finished eating.  First of all my waitress was very nice and relatively attentive.  Probably knew the breakfast food was trash.    I ordered the humble breakfast (2 eggs, sausage [small, wtf], fruit, potatoes, toast).  For some reason they only carry tabasco, makes me wonder where we're at.  But this isn't 1950s South Carolina.  We're in Phoenix, a Mexican Food Mecca.  That means, even if you're a pizza joint you have salsa at breakfast, or at least a Tapatio, I prefer Cholula.  Getting into the coffee, it was $3.29, it was a .50 coffee at best.  Tasted just like sludge and I'm not sure you could give it a name but it's the Biplane Blend apparently.  Now onto the eggs...Did I get the last of the baked pan?  These were not fresh and they were barely edible.  I guess I'll just go for the burrito at the fast-mex spot two places away next time.  But, what saves this from being a one was the waitress, like I said, she tried hard.

afpq6W5P90N5d_AH1EhM0A.text: Pizza was very good.  Came out relatively quick, which is good to know in an airport setting.  Problem was that although it looked and tasted pretty good, it was a mess to eat.  A lot of the topping came right off the crust when you tried to pick up each slice.    It was also a bit pricey for a 10in pizza.  But it's an airport.... Nothing is cheep!

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat Lovers

b3NYFq_8v21hulg4ce5TXg.text: I asked for a pepperoni with sausage - let's do the math : pepperoni $16.49 - meat lovers (that includes pepperoni and sausage plus two other meats) $18.69; instead of charging me the price for the meat lovers - they charge me an additional $4.69 on top of the $16.49 to add sausage ... either they're trained to try and gauge customers or they themselves cannot add .... either way, don't trust this place - even if you're gate C ... walk around and drink and eat somewhere else ....

Krc04CP0V131jZBHF6A3VA.text: Horrible Service  Got there at 5:30 am and was to board at 5:40 am  Worker said not open for another 3 minutes, when I asked how long it would take if I ordered 2 breakfast meals the person said 15 minutes. Appearantly she did not want to sell anything. I understand it is early but her attitude was horrible.

6YPJw-P7JwevSvB7EIpiUQ.text: Worst service ever. I watched a poor woman sit there patiently for 15 mins waiting to even order. We waited for 45 mins for food and almost missed our flight. We got there an hour and 15 before our flight to be prepared. Will never go back!

Lhkl9utJz2TRxzd4iBH-FA.text: I was pleased today to see that this place served breakfast and not just pizza!  I've been here several times in the past, but I've just gotten drinks.  I got to the airport pretty early before my flight and was really hungry.  The veggie omelette that I had was delicious!  It also came with fruit, potatoes and toast.  It's too bad they don't have more seating here, as it's always jam packed (in the evenings).  There were plenty of seats available this morning during the breakfast hour.  The service is good, but the wait for my food this morning felt like a very long time.  That could have possibly been that I was looking at my watch more than usual, as I was keeping an eye on my flight.  I'll be back here whether it's for breakfast, lunch, happy hour or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie omelette with avocado, potatoes and toast!

RQjDmQh5ErfH-oMRr0HaaQ.text: Rude hostess rude waitress. Me and my handicap father waited forever for a table it was finally our turn and they started seating people that came well after us!  When we inquired why there was 2 of us that table set 4 after the table set empty for 20 minutes they called the person below that. Still not us. No apologies nothing nice about the situation, at this point I wouldn't eat there if you paid me to.

lRy2XF-R62yALPBEqvnlag.text: 3 tv screens- two had college football, the other had MLB playoffs on... these guys know what's up! To top it off, our server Brian, quickly came to offer drinks and food. We ordered margherita pizza & pepperoni pizza- very nice! Airport food is not supposed to be this good! The games, good food, good drinks & excellent service is why you should spend the time away waiting for your flight (because you are always early and never late)!

S5r6ktxd2r_ID5JukK4bXQ.text: In a wordy... SKIMPY. I don't mind small portions, but wow. I had the breakfast burrito with bacon, which was in there, somewhere.  I think it had eggs too, at least that's what the description said. The fruit consisted of 5 grapes, a fingernail size piece of honeydew, and 2 pinky-sized parts cantaloupe.  Throw in the half cup (maybe) of potatoes & I'm not sure why this costs $11. I have been to other Humble Pie restaurants in the valley & always enjoyed them. If you are going to make the portions small, the quality better be high, and it wasn't. I know Humble Pie can do better.

vuUB4jYZtO6dDc6hz-ZeRQ.text: This is by far a solid pie, especially for it being located in an airport.   If you travel a lot, you know the crap you can get served and to be expected due to most service workers in the airports are not the pay friendliest - nor than likely due to having o deal with all the stressed-out travelers.  That said, this place is something I always look forward to.  Most of the servers are very pleasant and again, the food is excellent.    It's also worth noting...it's located in the middle of terminal D and the C terminals.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Carnivore - pretty damn solid for an airport pizza.

Tck0xWFS2FV3ZXAfIGKH7w.text: Terrible all the way around, find somewhere else to go while you are in the airport! It is a small bar and I was not acknowledged for a full seven minutes, and an order was not taken for another seven minutes, absolutely unacceptable considering the size of the bar and that there are two bartenders working. The one bartender saved the day, the other one should not be in the service industry, you have been warned!

JbE67VCeKqvAtahSiZ3sJQ.text: We stopped here to grab a bite while we waited for our flight. The seating was packed, though the food was pretty quick to be prepared. The pizza...nothing to brag about. It was basically the same as eating a frozen pizza, but marked up in price and with a few spices added on top. The sauce and crust were bland and unremarkable.

YEERYaoH6K6E9WbkmQv1Lw.text: Extremely slow services. First waited 10 mins before someone showed up to take the to go order. A hamburger with a side of fries was supposed to take 15 minutes, but I ended up waiting 40 mins. Hamburger was very dry and it came with salad instead of fries. Asked for ketchup and that was also missing from the bag. Nothing came how it supposed to. You are better off picking up food elsewhere.

V1tbucRZfRoZ_6ff0U_H7Q.text: Sweet Jesus! How did these People find their way to the Airport. My order was taken while 3 women leaned on a counter talking... eventually one woman made a few crusts then they ALL left even the cashier. After 15 minutes the women came back to continue talking. When I asked about the pizza one woman said, "what chu order?" Then she said "that ain't gonna happen, we outta pesto sauce". I asked what was cooking in the oven and she said, "Nothing ... we got some already made but they ain't got pesto... you want one of them?" I said "No" and she "well.... I don't know what to tell you!" After 35 mins of waiting a manager Arrived and said "oh, did we lose another one?" Watch the video I posted . How do they pay the rent 'cause they sure aren't selling pizza. These are the people celebrities create telethons and ribbons for out of hope for a cure. You can't cure this! Video will be posted on YouTube... this app won't allow it

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nm6jNrIGJPMeMccYbKvFzA.text: Barely edible. Overpriced. Eggs swimming in oil, cold bacon, week old fruit. Ok if you are starving otherwise skip it.

IG-UdAm-Np3D0XUZU8SIvg.text: Here's the thing, the airport is no longer a desolate wasteland of awful food, SO this makes the Humble Pie (which would have otherwise probably been a great airport option) not so great. The pizzas are expensive (our meatball pizza was about 17$) and wasn't that delicious. Was it bad? No, it just wasn't worth the 17$. There are better options in Sky Harbor (but if your flight leaves out of the gate next door and your pressed for time, it isn't the worst option either).

uFcrhqd1YsReM7decJUusg.text: From the looks of yelpers photos, some people had bad luck and got some really bad pizza, but from the attitude of this place, I would not be afraid to send it back to the kitchen and let them know about any soggy crust because it appears the kitchen WANTS to serve delicious pizza. Very attentive and patient servers even amid all the chaos of people coming and leaving and ordering to-go.  With that said, I was lucky to get a perfectly cooked magherita pizza ($10.95), lots of mozzarella toppings and some basil, the crust was thin, crunchy and chewy at the same time and STILL good the next day (for breakfast I heated it up in the microwave and finished it in the oven, for lunch i had the last slice cold, still. so. good.)  It's 4 stars only because it's on the pricey side, but otherwise I had a very satisfying pizza. Trying the chicken parmesan next time like the server enthusiastically suggested :)

OjE8f3mbiIfPPqLTA9Ucgg.text: This is an airport restaurant so expectations aren't that high however the time is important when estimating to your customers who are traveling. A carry out sandwich and salad estimated at 10-14 minutes took 32. When I asked and checked on it the reasoning they gave me was the pizza oven was full?? Then when I finally got my sandwich and asked how a full pizza oven impacted my grilled sandwich as you can imagine that was in no way the reason

BMkaXiTBAfA6iyA2RSnWsw.text: Ordered meat lovers omelette.  As most people in airports, had a flight to catch in about 45 minute.  Drastically burnt our omelettes AND bread.  Continuously empty waters and no compensations for ruined food.  Hire new cooks and servers immediately!

DYFEEalSI8-JIVJnsMS3mA.text: I picked up an egg, cheese, and potato breakfast burrito to eat during my flight.  I had it for about two hours and it kept really well!  It would be extremely easy to slap this combination together for a tasteless boring burrito.  I'm happy to report that it was not at all.  I definitely recommend getting the salsa they offer when you pick up your order.    If you want a meal to carry on that keeps well, this is a great choice.  Staff were very friendly as well.

9g1F-ox1taoZn-YTvCEE1g.text: Not a large selection of drinks, 4 beers on tap and limited hard alcohol. Burgers, salads and sandwiches on the menu. A lot of seating and a few tvs.

oq4eWJE7_9U8Vtlx6OL-ng.text: We had 20 minutes before our plane took off.  We ordered a simple pepperoni pizza!  They handed us a burnt black pizza.  Somebody actually looked at this thing coming out of the oven, saw it was pitch black, and then decided it was OK to hand it to a customer ! ! !  What makes a person think that it is ok to hand a customer such garbage?  Since they care so little about the interest of the customer, it makes you think they have other issues as well, cleanliness . . .

jaM4uSshfuOw4fSNPPXoTg.text: Roasted mushroom - waaaayyyy over done -like burnt.  Sad it smelled good when I walked up to order

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My over baked roasted mushroom - kind of bummed

4x7Us-3w9c5CslLOlYcmKw.text: Humility is only a thing worth mentioning when you have a recognizable skill to be humble about. That is not the case here and therefore I suggest they change there name to "the entirely accurate self perspective resulting in low self esteem pie."  The breakdown!   Service was good fast a friendly.  (That's why they got 2 and not one star)  For $8 I got what they called a breakfast wrap which is nothing more than a bad breakfast burrito. Maybe Mexico sued them, "a ese, this is no burrito, this is caca." Who knows, but I was greasy, gross, and the sausage taste like dog treats.    And yes I have sampled dog treats, but that's a story for another day.

LvG8AFxClcDgI8EwjlSn5Q.text: I experienced very poor customer service here before my flight.  I waited at the "to go" window for just over 5 min.  Made eye contact with several servers.  Was not acknowledged.  An annoyed man came over and "gruffly" says... "If you want to be served you'll have to come over to the bar."    Sorry, I was standing at what should allow me to bypass sitting down and ordering and waiting for a check...  No thanks.  How about you put a closed sign on the window?????  I would also suggest that you keep in mind that I am a customer.   Rude, loud and in-helpful will get you this review.    My advice to the restaurant?   Hire and train better.   There was many better was to handle this as an employee.... For instance ,  how about a friendly greeting?

jf3372PFMXXW8uLPeceb1A.text: Came for breakfast on my way out of town. Bloody Mary was awesome - the bartender Sean was great! The bacon was incredible. Prices are a little steep however, it's the airport...

fUyPO25goa7WenKgYY4GYA.text: Came across this place at the Phoenix Airport.  Ordered a beer I never heard of, Lifted Kilt I think it was called.  It was excellent!  The cheeseburger and fries I ordered were better than I expected from airport food.  Nice ciabatta roll served without condiments but with onion, lettuce and tomato slice.  Burger was juicy and cooked just right and a decent size.  Bar staff was funny and engaging.  The burger/fries platter was $12, beer was $9, not outrageous for airport food and the hot food was as much as you'd pay for a crummy pre-made sandwich at one of the newsstand outlets at the airport, so why not pull up a stool and enjoy a beer while you wait for your flight?

-WtFMLQw01Qx9xyRgI7SsA.text: Overpriced pizza. Staff is OK could be better. Pretty good pizza. Had the pepperoni pizza and would get again if I ever go back.

hOI_oiPF3RjYbS5S2sw-0w.text: Just picked up a light breakfast  and snacks here and was truly agitated by the service. This is an airport. People are usually in a rush and some have their hands full. After ordering and paying for my food (several items not easy carried) it was just left on the counter. I asked the guy at the register for a bag (very nicely) and instead of placing my order in a bag, like normal people in his position do, he throws the bag on top and starts taking the next persons order. My hands were full. So instead of speeding up his line he just slowed it down as he waited for me to bag my stuff. I come through here on a frequent basis - I won't stop by Humble Pie again. It's in Terminal A.   I walked past it later and noticed other travelers fumbling with their purchases as they got out of line because he simply could not put people's stuff in a bag. Ridiculous!

ekX5jWdblCeI75twN0yypA.text: I didn't eat the food. However I had a couple of beers. The service was perfect.  The beer was cold.  I was on a layover and it hit the spot.

vluS_xnsE85Va0GcLvprZA.text: Not to impressed. We bought a couple pies. Chicken pesto. Weird and ended up tossing. Roasted mushroom seemed salty and no sauce on it. I guess that if pizza is what you want, play it safe and stay with cheese or pepperoni.

3EUxnixrrw--2JmAnD5aew.text: (3.625) ~ Good Overall Food & Service.  Just wish they had the FULL menu of the downtown restaurant...  MY MENU: * Chocolate Chip Cookie = (3.75) ~ Good & semi-soft. * Margarita Pizza = (3.5) good

zCXyS7CV2GSYDjUc4VekhQ.text: The pizza is very expensive and in my opinion not worth it. $13 dollars for a personal pizza. I was hungry, but not that hungry, and I should've just waited until I returned home. But, flights always seem longer than they are, and it was right next to my gate, so it was convenient.  I had the chicken pesto pizza. It could've had more chicken. The crust was too dry for me. And the price....maybe we are paying for the little box it comes in? It was good tasting, but if it gets cold, it's not good at all. Better to eat it while it's hot and share with someone.   If you do eat here, listen for your name and really watch out for your order because people who ordered after you but had the same thing will try to take your order!

PbluXAXhDK8r7IRr1Fnbpw.text: Stop by humble pie to kill time before our flight. Once we got back I realized they charged my card 2x. I've left 2 messages to try and resolve this and no one has even called me back! Horrible customer service.

KBDga1Usg1OhTT8EI1Ty1w.text: Don't do it. Just don't. Horrible pizza and horrible service. The pizza is soggy with barely any toppings. If you're stuck in this part of the Phoenix airport terminal with a growling stomach and you have limited options, you're better off just starving. I made the mistake of eating here, and this is after eating at Pizzeria Bianco just a few days earlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horrible pizza

8LNgDr6Wq_W3wWPksmMv0g.text: Breakfast was on point!  Perfectly cooked potatoes, fresh fruit and amazing bacon/egg wrap.  One of the best I've had in a long time!!

I2Cn_x1s_p4QAIS-LScghQ.text: Bartender (Sean) is rude, rude, RUDE!!! If he doesn't enjoy his job maybe he should quit...or better yet FIRED!  Horrible customer experience!

fx1cXqxXE9W5xtxzsOt1bA.text: My flight is massively delayed and this restaurant is right next to the gate. I looked at pics on Yelp and read complaints about soggy pizza.  I didn't risk toppings to make it soggy. I also requested my plaint pie to be cooked well done.   The dough wasn't soggy.  If it was cooked well done then I'm afraid to ever eat a non-well done pizza.  The dough at its thickest point is the texture of a soft marshmallow.  The cheese tastes pretty good. The sauce is too sweet for my preference. Overall, I feel like I'm getting exercise with all the work I'm putting in eating the dough.   The employees here move slow and don't seem excited to serve. The 3 stars are given with generosity.

l6ffeFFsP1OUX8CRojfhmA.text: The only reason they are getting one star is the service person was very good at her job.  I should've used the app instead of my nose! The last time I was here I had a burrito at the Mexican food shop next door and it was atrocious, so today I went to Humble Pie for a breakfast wrap. $10.99 for a bacon egg and cheese wrap with a half cup of cubed potatoes, red & green bell peppers on the side and cup of fruit that looked like it should've been thrown out the day before yesterday.  I'm not sure what it is with this airport, but they can't get the food thing right!  Had I used the Yelp app, I would've made another choice, like peanuts on the flight!

ViDkF49BYypY3GXTFrH8Zg.text: No one in our family liked it, which is rare as we each like different types of pizza.  We have pizza a couple times per week. Super expensive.  Hardly had any cheese so it didn't really even taste like pizza.  Wish we thought of looking up yelp reviews before we landed for our layover.

pvZ4neWSGOxeEBIB3iDEzQ.text: Garbage food (see pics)  The blonde man who took my order was funny and a joy at 5am but the food was so sad for eleven bucks and made me sick to my stomach allllll day. I would have gone back for a refund but my flight was leaving- worst 1- bucks I've ever spent... the open box is how it was handed to me with the potatoes and fruit liking half eaten. RAWR.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vGS84hwf-e88vEM9b46bVw.text: As a infrequent traveler, I'm not up on the best eateries in every airport. Humble Pie had just a 3 star rating so I was a little leery to go in. However, the hostess greeted me graciously and with a smile so I went in. To my surprise, my server, Matthew, was just as friendly. I ordered 2 eggs over-medium with a coffee. Eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly and the coffee was tasty as well. I'd definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorry. I took the pic after taking a bite.

urEiQFts5nTtq691A8wDqQ.text: Beware the "signature char."  We ordered a BBQ Chicken Pizza. Seems pretty basic. When it arrived - after a 25 minute wait - the crust on half of it was burned black. We said "wow, that's really burned."  Our server said she would have it refired. We said we didn't have time because we had to catch a flight and so she walked off with the pizza. She didn't even give us the option of taking the non-burned portion to go. She was incredibly rude, dismissive and the antithesis of good customer service.

mFbeA_awvX7br5xZr-OHKA.text: I don't often have the opportunity to rate an airport eatery with more than 2 stars, but this place was an exception. My party of 4 was seated promptly by a friendly host. Our waitress, (Carol?) was very friendly and helpful. We ordered iced teas and a pretzel. Both were fresh and tasty. They make the mustard in-house, and it is really good. Then we ordered a meatball plate, a meatball pizza, and a BLT sandwich. All were served promptly and were delicious.

ngp5LYA-4_whvFrxBF7Rkg.text: Short Review: Do NOT eat here! If you do...you've done so at your own risk.  You've been warned!  Long Review: Oops I did it again. Damnit! I ate a completely disgusting airport restaurant meal. I said I'd never do it again, but I hadn't eaten all day, and...well now my stomach hurts!   Why is it so bad you ask? First, lets start with the name of the damn place! The etymology of "Humble Pie" gets its origins from "umble pie" evolved from numble, or deer innards. Ok, but let's take that a bit further... the saying "to eat humble pie" means, literally, "to be forced to acknowledge one's deficiencies or errors".  That is LITERALLY the meaning!!!  Why the f--k didn't I look that sh!T up before I ate there?!?!     Ok, now you wanna know exactly what was wrong? Well have you not read the other 30,000 reviews that told you how bad the food and service are? I didn't either before I ate there, Ok, fine, I'll tell you what I think. But hold on...  So I actually thought the menu was pretty decent for "a pizza place" in the airport. Typical stuff like personal pizzas, wings, salad, beer, cocktails. Same old stuff. I had just had 2 bottles of water earlier so I thought I'd treat myself to a Sprite to wash down my pizza. Ding #1: dude brings me a Sierra Mist.  For those of you who know the difference, this pisses you off too I'm sure. But wait...it was lacking carbonation so it was kinda watery. Seriously? Come on you guys!   Next, I ordered the fig, prosciutto, caramelized onion pizza. I've had this before at other, decent restaurants so I thought I could get something good for dinner, despite the awful soda. It came, and the crust was so thin that it couldn't actually stand the heat from the oven! It was literally a bubbly pizza! WTF? I had never seen anything like that. Even the people at the table next to us looked a little shocked. So what did my silly ass do? Yep...I bit into it. After the first bite I was kinda made a weird face.   It can't be this bad, I thought - in denial - so my dumb ass took another bite!! At that point, you know you're not hungry.  You're HANGRY!  I asked for another pizza because it was just inedible. The ingredients were old, you could just tell. So I thought well, they can't screw up a pepperoni pizza, so he brought me that instead. The bottom was burnt! I mean, I could have graffitied the walls with all the charcoal from the bottom of the slices! UGH, are you f--king kidding me????????  I just got the check.   Next time, I'll just starve.   Do not eat here. Do not eat here.

uWD8XrTUlORKSRMuZNQH0g.text: Ok.  It is the airport and the airport has crappy food right?  Well, Humble Pie is the exception.  They have a nice selection of creative pizza pies.   One of my favorites is the fig and prosciutto.  But you cannot go wrong with the Margarita, sausage or meat lovers.  The meatballs are my usual go to item since I don't need the carbs.  The beer and drink selection are on point.  Most of the bartenders are experienced.   They cannot make a Gibson but most places no longer carry cocktail onions.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Nb-q9XfRstiSJ5DTaCIqUA.text: Nice medium size meal but the best was the friendly service for an airport restaurant. Matthew G was a pleasure. I wanted to hire the guy!!

ORV-D4B5PeOUPeqVJjPo3g.text: The pizza is delicious but beware of the grey goose martinis. No price listed on the menu....because they are $17 effing dollars each. About fell off my chair when I realized this. They are tiny and not worth $17 dollars. JFC!!!!

IixzELiBFKfqRX0VqY2-vw.text: I loathe pulling up a chair at the bar and sitting... waiting... then having to ask for service, even though we had eye contact all the while she was doing side work.  Also not too keen on having to grab the bar rag myself, to wipe up the previous diners' crusty mess.  The food could knock my socks off but that won't matter once the tone is set.  Again one of those situations where a highly rated brick and mortar location is beholden to the poor service of an airport contracted company.  Btw. The meatballs (three meatballs & bread) were pretty good!

4y_6rFjURbC9s_j237x62g.text: Grumpy bartenders, loud servers, bland food, $16 tiny Bloody Mary's. Never, never again.

7xf7yzhWAiOnFdjTV9X4Bg.text: Ate here on a busy Friday night. Our server promptly came to our table to take our order. The food was good. The chicken sandwich was not offered with any sauce/mayo. I was not able to get our server to bring me anything. They are extremely overpriced. $10 for a draft blue moon is ridiculous.

1FGgIq9UwtrNg0JfyCjv7A.text: This airport location appears to be very popular.   We enjoyed the pizza (BBQ Chicken and Margherita).  The crust was good - chewy with some crispiness.    Sitting at the bar seems to be a free for all.  Although there were people standing in line waiting to be seated (including at the bar), others bypassed the line to grab a bar seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita

vhT8WFq508TaN187o8psAA.text: Food is 0 star Alcohol 2-3 stars Service 3-4 stars  **This was the only restaurant with bar at the C terminal - everything around was a nice walk down the long hall... I really enjoyed their angry monkey - whiskey and angry orchard apple beer... I was looking forward to the pizza and asked the server for his recommendation. He recommended the SOP - Sausage - Red bell peppers - caramelized onions. Pizza came out very timely - only problem was it was SOGGY - either their batter for the crust was crappy or very undercook. IT was so disgusting - I couldn't eat it - it was like cheesy globby casserole. The service saw my dissatisfaction and offered to bring me another as pizza IS NOT suppose to be soggy - they had another one that just came up the window...  I got my second pizza and it was still soggy - not as soggy as the first, I tried to salvage it by putting napkins bw the crust and the pizza - but the crust was non existent and everything just fell apart. I lost my appetite by then - the manager was nice enough to come by and apologize - I didn't want them to make me another as I had a flight to catch and I just picked off the sausage.  What a disappointed though. I will not be returning. You only have specialty to make which is pizza and this place missed the mark...

photos.caption: Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soggy sloppy pizza - fell apart
Photo of Humble Pie - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soggy pizza

zix7PyH8NWvVI1ZuWY9lZA.text: I whipped through airport security and decided to kill time over breakfast here before my flight. The layout of the restaurant is such that there is a large bar area with stool seating around it, and you walk past it to access table or booth seating. I was seated at a table, which I learned was not ideal: the table seating is set up so close together that your conversation immediately invites all of your neighbors, and I could actually smell the poor fellow's morning breath the next table over. Yikes!  Still, the server was incredibly friendly and nice (Mike, I believe), and asked each patron for their name and called them accordingly throughout their dining experiences. He was very observant about my coffee intake, and brought the kettle over for a refill as soon as I finished the last of my cup. I ordered the meat lover's omelette and asked for no potatoes, and he let me choose sliced tomatoes or a cup of fruit as substitution. The food was a perfectly hearty portion size, and was surprisingly very good! And the wait staff seemed to have no qualms with me spending some time after my meal to drink more coffee and read my book.  I am usually very wary of airport food, but would return here if I need a hearty breakfast and bottomless coffee again.

lLnLL32S01jlBfRfPQXQMQ.text: Food is good, service is good. But $15 for a single jim beam?  That is at least three times normal full price at a bar.  Food was premium and worth it.  But pizza cost less than Jim Beam?!  Bartender said he knew and agreed.  Spoke to manager and told him it was good food and good service but that the $15 was out of line. He replied, "I hear you."  But took no action. The point of customer service is to listen to customers... And that price is insulting.

7Uwfnx0gYKxdwTpivM6FfQ.text: Wow!  We were changing planes with a short layover in Phoenix and came across this newly opened place in Terminal C (Southwest) and decided to give it a try.  We both had the Sourdough burger.  Absolutely wonderful!  Nice thick juicy burger, thick grilled sourdough bread with grilled onions.  I had the salad with it - plenty of food!  Super fresh and delicious.  Prices weren't bad at all compared to the stuff you get at the airport.  Service was beyond excellent.  Pleasantly served and kept checking on us to see if there was anything else we needed.  Will definitely go back if we go through that way again - no hesitation!

S2M_y-V4E45i7Jjay0cbug.text: Friendly service, a nice dark beer, and a nine slice BLT. Prices are reasonable for an airport restaurant;if you are eating on a budget you're looking at corn nuts and coke. If you want a large drink and good sandwich at the end of the C concourse, you could do far worse and not much better than Humble Pie.

t7IZad2_Ns6EssUCq0efyw.text: The food is great but the service not so much.  I sat at the bar and ordered.  I got a great house pizza, which was delicious. Problem was, nobody ever did a callback.  I ate my entire meal before one of the bartenders asked if I wanted another drink.  The airport location is outrageously expensive.  The specialty pizzas run about $16 and the house wine is Tisdale. Tisdale is the worst crap out there and you can buy it in many stores for less than five dollars a bottle.  They charge $9.80 a glass for it. Be prepared!

GzRJwyFGP8FpxbBbDakbOg.text: I sat at the bar for breakfast. A woman came, sat beside me, and was waited on almost immediately. I glanced around to see additional people sitting at the bar with same immediate service. The waitress returned to the woman beside me to present her with a beverage, and refused to acknowledge my presence. It's as if I wasn't there, which is why I left and will never return. The food is generally bad enough in airports, and no one should be treated that way.

m5S65pvjUf_G9XthM-efNA.text: Came in on 7/28/16 with my family of 4. We were immediately acknowledged and sat at a table. There was a bit of a wait for the order and drinks to arrive, but that wasn't a problem. We ordered two 10" pizzas, one cheese for my daughter, and one bbq chicken pizza, which were both fantastic. The problem was that we also ordered a child pasta for my 5yo son which didn't show up until the very end of the rest of us being done eating. When it was delivered, we revived a small apology and was told she didn't know why it took so long for a child pasta, which was macaroni noodles, marinara, and meatballs and all they had times do was assemble. I gave it a three because the pizza was good. Service was ok, we weren't asked how the food was, or even received any discount.

i7Cdn5vTrwbRktIH_U1lcw.text: The last time I was at phoenix airport I had the worst pizza from that New York style pizza place so I see humble pie and was hesitant to try it but I really had no choice because the grill to the burger joint was down so after searching for other options I had to try it.  I got the pizza with roasted fennel and sausage and house mozzarella, and onions and loaded with sauce. So I don't know what Chris V was talking about when he said they don't put a lot of toppings in their pizza. It was loaded with toppings.  I absolutely loved it. Absolute turnaround from that other place. And originally I wanted a burger.

-_Z83MX5u5HKcVAdlBAE8w.text: This was a very rare experience at an airport bar/restaurant. Great food and even better were the 2 bartenders, Stacy and Ginger. I've been to so many places in airports and have never had a better time. Fun conversation started with those 2 and everyone else at the bar just having a good time. The only thing that sucks is that I can't frequent this place unless I'm traveling. Not sure how important these reviews are to the upper management, but KEEP THESE 2. Thanks for a really fun experience when I was expecting the usually grumpy airport employee.

eRSVkGyphdt4-V7P6LJw4g.text: A cheap & healthy meal at the airport...Spicy Minestrone Soup, just a little over $4.00 (after taxes).  Service was "ok," but we're sort at the mercy of these people being stuck at the airport, right? Thankfully the soup was tasty and filling, so it head me over till my flight.

okn5BJXug3jhymKr1EBTrg.text: Nice stop to relax during  a delayed flight. There are lots of different kinds of pizza. They're decent, not the best I've ever had. Airport pricing of course.

fUVhvbuMlD7KfXpnzyqOUA.text: Excellent service! The moment I sat down at the bar the bartender, Jack, asked for my name and called my by my name the entire time. It made the atmosphere feel real friendly as if I were a regular at a local bar. The pizza I ordered tasted amazing, I really enjoyed the mozzarella they used on their pizzas.  I will defiantly stop here the next time I'm flying out of Phoenix!

Y6lkX7r_zo-BAdN18HVK5w.text: Worst management staff ever.  Simple request to change a game to a Michigan football game was met with a no and that they don't have any remotes. What a douchebag.

G9d6qFgn9q7NXLtmgJylXw.text: I only stopped in today for coffee and it's only their third day open. They were slammed and did a good job trying to help me even though their takeout window isn't opened yet. The one lets looked amazing as I watched them go by. I wish I wasn't so crazy about getting I my flight be because I would stopped and had one they looked so good!

p5ZzRzaP5mY5jrIo5XnumA.text: The food was solid 4 star but it was at the airport so I am jumping it up a notch. My taste buds were simply blown away!! Ordered the S.O.P which has sausage, caramelized onions, roasted red peppers, mozzarella, ricotta cheese and tomato sauce. The sauce tasted very tomato-y and fresh, the cheese was perfect, the sausage and onion complimented and the crust was crispy but not burnt. Really great pizza that I would happily eat outside of the airport walls.

bUIpkQO6fSkuoFbkYgaRoQ.text: The best host is Miguel . Just impress which he could work at my store . Most clever personality. He helped me with everything I needed

U0AfS9IF2Vr2ZQCRKx5xUg.text: Pizzas are a little small and pricey. They're OK for being in the Phoenix airport.

lmOsSKuQ4qRDnTzwaR0EzQ.text: Order: Humble Pie Breakfast (two eggs, breakfast potatoes, toast and bacon or sausage). I got scrambled eggs and bacon. $7.50 + tax.  Food: Eggs were angular and looked waxy, like they were instant eggs but made in a pan. I got a corner edge so there was a hard, darker egg part that I could not eat. Toast wasn't toasted. Bacon was good. Sausage was acceptable.  Staff: Excellent and quick (in and out in about 10 minutes).  Overall: They should stick to pizza but they'll get everything out quickly.

zbt1RVbFC6NWa4MLnauMhA.text: I placed my order at Humble Pie 40 minutes before my flight was scheduled to board and continued with my order after being told it would be 10-15 minutes max. After 45 minutes my flight was midway through boarding and I was still pizza-less. I was finally told that my pizza was "messed up" (it had gotten stuck in the pan and then fell on the floor in an effort to get it out) and it had to be re-made over the next "10-15 minutes." When I asked for a refund in order to make my quickly approaching departure I was told that it would take a while to get a manager to authorize the refund. Instead I was told I could grab $11.80 worth of pre packaged cookies and/or apples from near the register to make up the price of the pizza. A manager made it to the register rather quickly when I began to protest and I made my flight with refund in hand albeit quite hungry.

4QTsmWtq4E4AID7IXfQxXA.text: I woke up on the wrong side of/under the bed this morning for an insanely early flight. During my layover in Phoenix, I stopped at Humble Pie for a drink. Ginger and Maryanne are hilarious, fast and friendly. Food, drinks, comedy!!! I highly recommend this watering hole!

spwWkBsiPGe_rVmfjmpDCw.text: Taken aback by the prices, but one is a captive audience in an airport.  Ordered the the mushroom pancetta.  Was asked, would you like the pancetta?  Um yes.  Got pizza.  No pancetta.  Completely flavorless hot goo mess $15 "pizza".  Skip this place.

NNPt9XyghuB7gAhVMLAkCA.text: Dashing through the airport to catch a flight, I grabbed their strawberry and Gorgonzola salad.  What luck!  It was so fresh and flavorful.  I became so obsessed with it that I looked up their other AZ locations.  I was not a huge fan of Gorgonzola before but this salad has converted me.

qNCvTLSrkTYBKiN2EnJHXA.text: Very pleasantly surprised ... good pizza in an airport!  I ordered using the self-serve kiosk, and had a super hot margherita pizza in my hands in less than 5 minutes.  It isn't the best pizza I've ever had, but usual to find this quality and speed in an airport.  Staff was very friendly to boot.  Pricey @ $11, but I'm on business travel....

AJ-9oaLHhf4HIwOC8OD8sQ.text: One of the worst pizzas I've ever had in all my life. Its not an exaggeration trust me. After a long flight from St.Louis to west side of the coast and a quick halt at arizona we brought our semi hungry selves to this place and we fell short of food options at the terminal we were in. We browsed through their selection of pizza to find a vegetarian option and we went with the margherita pizza topped with basil and tomatoes. Unbelievable as to how could someone completely turn around the recipe made with scramble of simple ingredients. The crust was horrible and the basil wasn't baked along with the pizza it was rather sprinkled ribbon cut over the baked pizza with just marinara.It was like the leaves were flying away as we were trying to bite into the pizza. Gosh and the price I know that its airport and its supposed to be pricey but 14 dollars for a flat iron rubber like pizza duh! Please don't eat even if you are starving you'll just end up spoiling your tastebuds.

_PzlUIc4sa0MsDPyv_XUpw.text: Worst service ever experienced at an airport! Tiffany the server is awful and the hostess was rude and unaccommodating!  This restaurant is awful!!!

A4WvPpq0zLdDqdTm1l_KOw.text: As the only full service option in this section of gates, and with the other to go places overloaded, this is far from my first option.   I usually only come here for the breakfast, which is satisfactory. But the service is horrendously slow and inattentive. This morning, I was actually helped to a seat after 10 minutes of waiting for anyone to even approach me. The woman who helped isn't even from this location and was just here to help today.   I even watched a cook come out to have to help clear tables.   If you have time to kill for mediocre food and being ignored by the servers, this is your go to place.   The second star is only for the poor woman trying to do her best to carry this restaurant.

apELY5GksHhYbra55Gn9iA.text: Chase the bar tender was very un pleasesent. I would not come back here.   2 stars for food and customer services

HId_YHiNq_xc0USwoJxpow.text: Ordered a Gluten Free Pizza after speaking with the manager to ensure what I was ordering was correct and Gluten Free as I have Celiacs disease.  Unfortunately the pizza made me extremely sick for my 4.5 hour flight home and continues to do so today. Thank you Humble Pie for ruining the end of a great vacation. Do not advertise GF if you dont know how to handle it or to be careful when making it. As I took my first bite while we were in mid take off... I felt the flour in my mouth. I spit out my food but it was already too late. You cannot bake GF crust on top of flour residue from regular gluten containing pizza and expect it to be ok. Shame on you!!!

Wp6O6wstWSqmEKSwCiLm2g.text: If you want to overpay for half a glass of beer, this is the place to be. After waiting to get a spot at the bar, asked for a kilt lifter, and was given a fancy Dixie cup's worth. Asked how much, $9.75. I politely passed and left.   I expect to be overcharged at the airport bar, but to be given half a serving is new to me.  Edit:  went down to Barrio Cafe in gate D and got a full serving for the same price. Asked the Barrio bartender and he explained this was run by a different company, HMS, which doesn't extort its customers on overpriced half servings.

EBXykS_e2YCbQM0Ois6OtQ.text: I got the roasted mushroom. I wish it had sauce but it did have a lot of flavor. If you don't like mushrooms don't get it, obviously. This place was really good staff was friendly, just pricey. The hamburger looked good, pretty basic. It's a nice secluded spot in the airport with booths.

Q8TFFehJb9-G8FL_pHHJuQ.text: Located inside the Phoenix airport,  this is a decent choice for food while you wait for your connecting flight.   It's airport food so it's not the greatest but my margarita pizza was edible and it was relatively fast to get.

PWHEfYmJvamYcx9ApRIXqA.text: Ordered a BLT.  Not a horrible sandwich, but the bacon tended to taste a bit like the grill it was cooked on, which means the grill needed to be cleaned.  Fries were ok however the ketchup that was on the table was awful.  Not sure what was going on there.  Overall ok for airport food however, if this was a restaurant outside of an airport (where my standards and expectations would be higher) this would be a big nope.  Most likely this is really a 2.5, but that's not a choice so they get the benefit of a doubt

Jr9WADk7zcYRBenV4Y0xcw.text: Slow service, horrible fries, cook was throwing a fit about having to cook another order. Stopped thinking 40 minutes should be plenty of time to eat before our daughter landed. Took all of that and then some. Sourdough burger was supposed to have house dressing, but was super dry with no dressing. Didn't complain as I was hungry and pressed for time.

DmzGpCHAT0CqV9HaTzVvVw.text: Came here on a Friday due to a delay. The cheese pizza tasted great and my wife enjoyed the chicken sandwich. The server, Rebecca was busy but gave us great service. The are having a survey contest which she told us about for an extra bonus on her check.  They need to reconsider drink prices a bit. I get it's the airport but $12 for a vodka/soda and $9.50 for a blue moon are steep.

3_QVbn7QqkJ2ggNA1OK2Ww.text: Terrible.  All crust.  Not a lot of anything else.    Pass.  Get a taco next door or Panera in the next Gaye over.

dwASRSGvwB_52Yk-8aR89g.text: Watch out the price for alcohol is $1 more than what is listed in their menu... $15 Bloody Mary, charged $16...

akwxYKMlpmtkhiUvNjXkzQ.text: Had a long layover around lunch time and the menu had options that sounded good. Ordered a Moscow mule based on the ad in their drink menu. The waitress proceeded to tell me they don't carry ginger beer but can use a ginger vodka with ginger ale. I agreed to try it. She then came back and said they were out of ginger vodka so basically the drink would be plain vodka with ginger ale. I didn't care at that point. It was fine but not a Moscow mule.  I ate the sourdough burger with fries. It was good but not anything special. It did take a while for the food to get to me and the fries were not warm. Would probably go somewhere else if i was in the same situation again.

QdKN0O83QwCurNaDJ3cNdg.text: I didn't have super high hopes but at least if a place offers sangria, it would be nice if it wasn't just a bottle of "sangria". It was garnished with an orange slice and a cherry which were definitely not soaked. The wine itself tasted watered down so putting the sangria label on it feels cheap. Not worth my $9. I didn't think to read the description of the margherita pizza because it's self explanatory, but there are no tomatoes. It is just a cheese pizza with a little basil. Good, but I was a little disappointed when it arrived and then I read the description.

XRHd2MK0GQhPW-eo5YHr-Q.text: The service here is fast and great. The pizza is salty to the point it could not be consumed. I was too hungry so I ate it but I think I got 5+ refills on my drink to do so

ytjWZ6viMRxC_B_6ByyNtw.text: I've been to many airport bars, some are better than others, some are downright terrible (Madison, WI), this one falls directly in the middle. Service is ok, but really slow... I get it - it's busy! But that's the point! People want a drink before their flights and no one wants to wait too long... they need to hire more staff!

LKEB0IVutEQ-VOCZoFRwmA.text: I can't say much for their food because I didn't order anything but a word to the wise, don't stop here if you're looking for a cheap mimosas. $12 for one flute. I'll pass next time. Also, didn't have hardly any veg options.

FfEDJ7zfW1Odjh25cyLk2A.text: Not a good choice unless you intentionally want to kill time sitting at a restaurant. Pizzas sound good on paper, but mine was subpar. Service was horrendous especially considering it's in an airport. Waited 10+ minutes just to place our order, so when the food arrived before we even started eating we preemptively asked for to-go boxes and the check in order to get out of there faster. Our check came 10+ minutes later. We tried to pay while finishing our food and could not get the attention of a server for a good 20 minutes, even with my friend literally holding the receipt and credit card up in the air! It got to the point that we had to actually get up and approach someone to ASK to pay. Luckily we had plenty of time before our flight. Even so, extremely annoying and the food didn't save the experience. Go somewhere else

YR3throynMeOw1M79yVgfg.text: Very Pricey even for an airport establishment.  Food a C-, they are stingy with the cheese on the pizza's.  Kind of dirty also.

4P6CO6m6l_K1qhHdcwb8kw.text: Now I know why this place has relatively low stars. I've been waiting for lunch for about 40 minutes with a waiter who obviously does not care. Please ask for someone else if you get "Ginger". Not only I did my wine arrive in a dirty glass, wait for the picture, but the coveted signature meatballs were cold upon arrival. Maybe they were warm when they first arrived on the line but even the "sauce" looked like it had set.   To make matters worse, 3 parties sat around me, all received food before I did. They may have a chance when I return to Phoenix, but for right now, thumbs down all the way!!
